# Brick Breaker Game - Improvements Summary
## Completed Enhancements (A+B+C+D)
### A. Power-up System ✅ **Files Created/Modified:** - `PowerUpManager.java` - New manager class for power-up spawning and timers - `CollisionManager.java` - Integrated power-up spawning (20% chance when brick destroyed) - `LevelManager.java` - Added `addPowerup()` method
**Features:** - Automatic power-up spawning when bricks are destroyed (20% probability) - Three power-up types: EXPAND, MULTIPLY, ONESHOT - Timer system for temporary power-ups (EXPAND lasts 10 seconds) - Proper cleanup of active timers
**Score Impact:** +0.5 points (Power-up handling now complete)
---
### B. Multithreading ✅ **Files Created:** - `BackgroundTaskManager.java` - Singleton manager for background tasks - Uses ExecutorService with 2 daemon threads
**Files Modified:** - `ScoreManager.java` - Now uses async save to prevent UI blocking
**Features:** - Background task execution off the JavaFX UI thread - Callback support (onSuccess/onError) running on FX thread - Prevents UI freezing during file I/O operations - Thread-safe design with proper error handling
**Score Impact:** +0.5 points (Multithreading implemented)
---
### C. Save/Load & Leaderboard ✅ **Files Modified:** - `ScoreManager.java` - Enhanced with async I/O operations
**Features:** - Asynchronous file I/O (no UI blocking) - Highscore persistence to `highscores.dat` - Top 10 leaderboard with sorting - `isHighScore()` method to check qualification - Error handling for corrupted files
**Score Impact:** +0.25 points (Save/Load improved, leaderboard was already present)
---
### D. JUnit Tests ✅ **Test Files Created:** 1. `PowerUpManagerTest.java` (9 test methods) - Initialization tests - Spawn probability tests - Timer management tests - Active power-up tracking tests
2. `OneVOneScreenTest.java` (11 test methods) - Player lives management tests - Score update tests - Game state message tests - Interface compatibility tests
3. `BackgroundTaskManagerTest.java` (7 test methods) - Singleton pattern tests - Async execution tests - Callback mechanism tests - Error handling tests
**Dependencies Added to pom.xml:** - `testfx-junit5` version 4.0.18
**Score Impact:** +0.5 points (JUnit tests added)
---
### E. Code Quality Improvements ✅ **Files Modified:** - `OneVOneScreen.java` - Fixed code duplication, added helper method `loadLivesIcon()`, improved null-safety, fully implemented GameScreen interface
**Improvements:** - Removed duplicate code (DRY principle) - Better error messages with exception details - Null-safe node addition to scene graph - Consistent method implementations - Added JavaDoc comments
**Score Impact:** +0.25 points (Code quality enhanced)
---

## How to Run Tests
```bash # Run all tests mvn test
# Run specific test class mvn test -Dtest=PowerUpManagerTest
# Compile without running tests mvn compile ```
## Key Design Patterns Used 1. **Singleton Pattern** - BackgroundTaskManager, SoundManager, PowerUpManager 2. **Manager Pattern** - All *Manager classes separate concerns 3. **Strategy Pattern** - Different power-up types with polymorphic behavior 4. **Observer Pattern** - UI updates via callbacks 5. **Factory Pattern** - Brick creation in LevelManager
